modules.description: This module computes SWHIDs for content, directories, releases, revisions, and snapshots using SHA1 hashing and OS operations. It processes directory entries, version control metadata, and timestamps to generate identifiers for software heritage objects. Concrete use cases include calculating identifiers for version-controlled files, directory trees, Git commits, and repository snapshots.

This module generates SWHIDs for software artifacts like files, directories, commits, and repository snapshots by combining SHA1 hashes with metadata from version control systems and file systems. It processes directory structures, Git references, timestamps, and object contents to create persistent identifiers. You can use it to compute identifiers for a file's contents, a directory tree at a specific commit, or a full repository snapshot. Example uses include tracking revisions in Git repositories or generating unique IDs for archived software components.
